metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12392 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When manipulating user events in nested loops while opening a document through script, it is possible to trigger a potentially exploitable crash due to poor event handling. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 63, Firefox ESR < 60.3, and Thunderbird < 60.3.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12392` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

thunderbird - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
